Being a flight attendant is interesting,

especially those who have

there exists a spectrum of people.

There are humans who are

So, I was on a flight where

This is reasonable, and

the announcements were always very binary,

unfortunately we have a

on today's flight, so in

we will not be serving peanuts.

Thank you very much

and we were still like
definitely on an incline.

Not a big deal, but right after
she makes that announcement
I hear a ding.
Someone has pressed their call button,

and nobody ever presses their
call button during takeoff,
after we have just left the ground.

So, my brain goes to this
must be an emergency.
I will help them.
I get out of my jump seat,

and I start like mountain
climbing up the plane.

I have to grab seats as I go
in order to not fall backwards
and it's like a legitimate hike.
No one else on my crew got up to do this,
because they are smarter than me.

I finally reached the gentleman
who has pressed call button
and I say hi sir, is everything all right?
Can I help you, what is going on?

I see that you've pressed
your call button on takeoff.

Please tell me what, why,
why, why are you do the thing?

And this guy just turns his
head with the smuggest look
on his face and without any context asks

can you tell me what they do
at the grocery store, miss?

And obviously this didn't
make any sense to me.
Who is they, and what, why are we talking
about the grocery store?

Why are we doing this what
the plane is still trying

So, I just say I'm sorry, what?

obnoxious expression,
he kindly explains to silly me,
oh, I'm talking about the peanut allergy,
what do they do at the grocery store?

Do they call ahead and
ask the grocery store

I'm just curious.

If they don't do that there,
why should we do that here?
Huh, miss, huh?

In that moment, my brain

So, I froze and stared

in my tiny stewardess mind
started turning again.
